markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Betraying Shank](/Feats.aspx?ID=4117) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 79</row>

**Archetype** [Twilight Speaker](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=203)

**Prerequisites**
[Twilight Speaker Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4114)

**Requirements**
You are within melee reach of a target, but it is not in combat with you.

</column>

---

While your usual diplomacy is well intentioned, you know that sometimes those same skills will need to be turned to deception. In a flash, you draw a sheathed or concealed [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) or [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179) weapon and make a melee Strike. The target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against your Strike. You then roll [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) for initiative.
name: Betraying Shank
requirement: You are within melee reach of a target, but it is not in combat with you.
